Cranberry Salad

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to your new favorite holiday dish – Cranberry Salad! Bursting with vibrant flavors and textures, this delightful salad is a perfect blend of tart cranberries, sweet pineapple, and creamy whipped topping, making it an ideal side for festive gatherings and family dinners. Not only is this cranberry salad incredibly easy to prepare, but it's also a crowd-pleaser that brings a touch of sweetness to your traditional holiday meals. With just a handful of simple ingredients including fresh cranberries, mini marshmallows, and chopped pecans, you can create a refreshing dish that complements savory entrees beautifully. Whether you’re hosting a Thanksgiving feast or attending a potluck, this cranberry salad is sure to impress. So gather your ingredients, and let’s dive into this simple yet delicious recipe that will become a staple in your holiday repertoire!

Ingredients

fresh cranberries

Choose firm, plump cranberries that are deep red in color. If you can't find fresh cranberries, you can substitute them with frozen cranberries; just make sure to thaw and drain excess moisture before using.

granulated sugar

Adjust the amount of sugar based on your taste preference and the tartness of the cranberries. For a healthier option, consider using honey, maple syrup, or a sugar substitute, but keep in mind that it may alter the texture.

pineapple chunks (canned)

Select chunks packed in juice or light syrup for a healthier choice. If you prefer fresh pineapple, you can cut fresh pineapple into chunks, but remember to adjust the sweetness since fresh pineapples can vary in sweetness.

mini marshmallows

If you want to add more texture, consider using chopped large marshmallows or even toasted coconut flakes. For a healthier twist, you can skip the marshmallows or use a sugar-free variety.

chopped pecans

Toast the pecans in a dry skillet over medium heat for a few minutes to enhance their flavor. If you have nut allergies, you can substitute with sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds for a crunchy texture.

whipped topping

For a lighter version, you can use homemade whipped cream or Greek yogurt. If you're looking for a non-dairy option, coconut whipped cream works well as a substitute.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Cranberries

    Rinse the fresh cranberries under cold water to remove any dirt. Inspect them closely and remove any stems or bad berries. Only use the firm, bright red ones for the best flavor.

  • Step 2: Macerate the Cranberries

    In a mixing bowl, combine the rinsed cranberries with 1 cup of granulated sugar. Let this mixture sit for about 10 minutes. This process, known as maceration, helps to draw out the juices from the cranberries and softens their tart flavor, balancing the sweetness.

  • Step 3: Combine Other Ingredients

    After 10 minutes, add 1 can (20 oz) of drained pineapple chunks, 1 cup of mini marshmallows, and 1/2 cup of chopped pecans to the cranberry and sugar mixture. Stir gently to combine all the ingredients evenly without smashing the cranberries.

  • Step 4: Fold in Whipped Topping

    Gently fold in 1 cup of whipped topping into the mixture. Be careful not to over-mix; you want to maintain a light and fluffy texture. This will give your salad a creamy consistency.

  • Step 5: Chill Before Serving

    Transfer the cranberry salad into a serving bowl and cover it with plastic wrap. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. This allows the flavors to meld together and enhances the overall taste.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly rinse and prepare fresh cranberries?

To rinse fresh cranberries, place them in a colander and run cold water over them. Remove any stems or bad berries (those that are soft or discolored) by hand.

Why do I need to let the cranberries and sugar sit for 10 minutes?

Letting the cranberries and sugar sit allows the cranberries to release some of their juices, which helps to create a syrup that enhances the flavor of the salad.

How do I drain canned pineapple chunks properly?

To drain canned pineapple chunks, open the can and pour the contents into a colander or a strainer. Let it sit for a few minutes to remove excess juice, which can make your salad watery.

What does it mean to 'fold in' the whipped topping?

Folding in means gently mixing the whipped topping into the other ingredients without deflating it. Use a spatula to lift the mixture from the bottom and fold it over the top, turning the bowl as you go.

How long can I chill the salad before serving?

You can chill the salad for at least 30 minutes, but it can be made several hours in advance. Just keep it covered in the refrigerator until you're ready to serve.

Can I use a different type of nut instead of pecans?

Absolutely! If you prefer, you can substitute chopped walnuts, almonds, or even sunflower seeds for a nut-free option.

What should I do if I don’t have whipped topping?

You can use homemade whipped cream instead. Just whip heavy cream with a little sugar until soft peaks form, and then fold it into the salad like you would with the whipped topping.

How can I make this salad healthier?

You can reduce the sugar amount or use a sugar substitute. Adding fresh fruit like diced apples or oranges can also enhance the flavor and add nutritional value.

What’s the best way to serve this salad?

Serve the salad in a large bowl with a ladle for scooping, or in individual cups for a more elegant presentation. Garnish with extra pecans or a sprinkle of cinnamon if desired.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad can be made gluten-free and vegetarian as is. For a dairy-free version, swap the whipped topping with a coconut cream or a dairy-free whipped topping alternative. To reduce sugar, consider using less sugar or a sugar substitute like stevia, but remember it may alter the texture slightly. Ensure that the canned pineapple is packed in juice or water to avoid added sugars.

Pairings

This Cranberry Salad pairs beautifully with holiday roasts such as turkey or ham, providing a sweet and tart contrast to savory dishes. It can also complement a cheese board featuring creamy cheeses like Brie or goat cheese. For beverages, consider serving it with a light sparkling wine, a sweet Riesling, or a festive apple cider to enhance the flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Cranberry Salad in a clear glass bowl or individual dessert cups to showcase its vibrant colors. Garnish with a sprinkle of additional chopped pecans or a few fresh cranberries on top for visual appeal. For an added touch, consider serving it alongside a scoop of vanilla ice cream or as a filling in a parfait glass layered with additional whipped topping and granola for texture.

#

Cranberry Salad

10 min
$8
250 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

Nuts

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

American

Course:

SaladSide Dish

Tags:

SaladEasyQuickHealthy

Description

A refreshing salad with a tangy twist, perfect for any occasion!

Ingredients

  • fresh cranberries: 2 cups
  • granulated sugar: 1 cup
  • pineapple chunks (canned): 1 can (20 oz)
  • mini marshmallows: 1 cup
  • chopped pecans: 1/2 cup
  • whipped topping: 1 cup
